item.title: About me
item.description: I am an educator, researcher, data scientist, and writer. I am currently the Associate Director of Early Childhood Program Performance at the Virginia Department of Education, where I work to expand access to and improve the quality of early childhood education programs across the state of Virginia. In my free time, I enjoy reading, writing, data visualization/modeling, going to the gym, and spending time with friends & family (including my pup, Nala).

item.title: Publications
item.description:
You can also check out my profiles on Google Scholar and Researchgate
Peer-Reviewed Publications Gellock, J., Ekholm, E., Greenhalgh, G., LeCrom, C., Reina, C., & Kudesia, R. (2019). Women’s lacrosse players’ perceptions of teammate leadership: Examining athlete leadership behaviors, attributes, and interactions. Journal of Athlete Development and Experience, 1(2), 2. https://scholarworks.bgsu.edu/jade/vol1/iss2/2. Zumbrunn, S., Marrs, S., Broda, M., Ekholm, E., Jackson, L., & DeBusk-Lane, M. (2019). Toward a more complete understanding of writing enjoyment: A mixed methods study of elementary students.

item.title: Visualizations
item.description: This page presents a collection of data visualizations I’ve created, mostly for fun/in my free time. All visualizations were created using the R programming language. #TidyTuesday Visuals #TidyTuesday is a weekly data analysis and visualization project run by the [R4DS Online Learning Community] intended to provide R users with opportunities to refine their skills. The visuals below are my contributions #TidyTuesday. Code for all plots is in my Github.
